intro: Mesodactylis, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Mesodactylis has oval, dark green leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. It is native to parts of North America and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats.
